alert.note: Alert for Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 7:18PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Seneca and west central Cayuga Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 718 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Geneva, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Romulus, Fayette, Union Springs, Aurora, Canoga, Border City, Rose Hill and Cayuga Lake State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
